intro: Spermacoce macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved horsegram, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and can grow quite large, contributing to its common name. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
